title: Conservatives thrilled by Tim Scott
content:
Republicans cite Scott 's conservative credentials and the diversity he brings to the table . Conservatives thrilled by Tim Scott
Conservatives online cheered the news on Monday that Rep. Tim Scott has been picked for Sen. Jim DeMint ’ s South Carolina Senate seat , citing both his conservative credentials and the diversity he brings to the table .
Guy Benson of Townhall.com noted on Twitter , “ . @ townhallcom readership reaction is pretty much unanimous : Enthusiastic virtual applause for Gov . Haley ’ s pick of Tim Scott for US Senate . ”
Katie Pavlich , also of Townhall.com , added , “ Super happy about Tim Scott , great job Nikki Haley . ”
Ana Navarro , who served as a co-chair for Hispanic outreach during Sen. John McCain ’ s 2008 presidential bid and is an advocate for more diversity in the GOP , also praised the pick .
“ We ’ ve come a long way from Thurmond days ‘ SC Gov to name Tim Scott , SC ’ s 1st African-American GOP Rep since 1901 , to replace Sen Jim DeMint ’ ” , she tweeted .
“ So happy it ’ s Tim Scott that will replace Sen. DeMint ! , ” offered Kathleen McKinley , a conservative blogger .
“ Tim Scott has taken our core values seriously in the House and we have every reason to expect similar , principled behavior in the Senate , ” said Jenny Beth Martin , co-founder of the Tea Party Patriots group , in a statement .
Scott , a Republican congressman from the Palmetto State , was tapped Monday by Gov . Nikki Haley to succeed DeMint , a tea party darling . He will be the only African American in the Senate .
“ Tim Scott is among perhaps the rarest kind of Washington official : One who knows how to articulate the moral case for conservatism and explain our fiscal challenges to the average American , ” said Ned Ryun , the president and CEO of the conservative group American Majority Action , in a statement . “ This form of leadership outweighs identity politics . ”
Sen. Lindsey Graham ( R-S.C. ) , who will serve with Scott , welcomed him via Twitter .
“ Tim Scott is an even better person than he is politician , ” read a tweet on Graham ’ s account .
Scott beat the son of Strom Thurmond — the elder Thurmond was a South Carolina senator who was an outspoken advocate of segregation at times during his career — in a 2010 primary race . He will be the first African American to represent the South in the Senate since Reconstruction when he replaces DeMint , who is leaving to head up the conservative Heritage Foundation , a think tank .
Joel Pollak of the conservative Breitbart.com referenced that background in a biting tweet , which he followed up with a tweet praising the senator-elect .
“ Racist sexist Tea Party Republicans to welcome @ RepTimScott as 1st black Senator from South since Reconstruction thanks to female Indian gov , ” he wrote . Later , he clarified , “ @ RepTimScott a man of character & principle . Dems have diversity problem—e.g . fewer Latino elected ldrs . ‘ White ’ GOP is a lie . ”
The conservative commentator Dana Loesch tweeted , “ great news about Rep. Tim Scott . ”
Colin Hanna , the president of the conservative group Let Freedom Ring , also heaped praise on Scott .
“ Gov . Nikki Haley made a wise and courageous choice by nominating Rep. Tim Scott , ” Hanna said in a statement . “ Sen . DeMint was a voice for limited government , fiscal responsibility and the advance of liberty . We have the same hopes for Tim Scott . ”

Republicans cite Scott's conservative credentials and the diversity he brings to the table. Conservatives thrilled by Tim Scott

Conservatives online cheered the news on Monday that Rep. Tim Scott has been picked for Sen. Jim DeMint’s South Carolina Senate seat, citing both his conservative credentials and the diversity he brings to the table.

Guy Benson of Townhall.com noted on Twitter, “ .@townhallcom readership reaction is pretty much unanimous: Enthusiastic virtual applause for Gov. Haley’s pick of Tim Scott for US Senate.”

Katie Pavlich, also of Townhall.com, added, “Super happy about Tim Scott, great job Nikki Haley.”

( Also on POLITICO: 10 facts about Tim Scott)

Ana Navarro, who served as a co-chair for Hispanic outreach during Sen. John McCain’s 2008 presidential bid and is an advocate for more diversity in the GOP, also praised the pick.

“We’ve come a long way from Thurmond days ‘SC Gov to name Tim Scott, SC’s 1st African-American GOP Rep since 1901, to replace Sen Jim DeMint’”, she tweeted.

“So happy it’s Tim Scott that will replace Sen. DeMint!,” offered Kathleen McKinley, a conservative blogger.

( PHOTOS: Tim Scott’s career)

“Tim Scott has taken our core values seriously in the House and we have every reason to expect similar, principled behavior in the Senate,” said Jenny Beth Martin, co-founder of the Tea Party Patriots group, in a statement.

Scott, a Republican congressman from the Palmetto State, was tapped Monday by Gov. Nikki Haley to succeed DeMint, a tea party darling. He will be the only African American in the Senate.

“Tim Scott is among perhaps the rarest kind of Washington official: One who knows how to articulate the moral case for conservatism and explain our fiscal challenges to the average American,” said Ned Ryun, the president and CEO of the conservative group American Majority Action, in a statement. “This form of leadership outweighs identity politics.”

Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.), who will serve with Scott, welcomed him via Twitter.

“Tim Scott is an even better person than he is politician,” read a tweet on Graham’s account.

Scott beat the son of Strom Thurmond — the elder Thurmond was a South Carolina senator who was an outspoken advocate of segregation at times during his career — in a 2010 primary race. He will be the first African American to represent the South in the Senate since Reconstruction when he replaces DeMint, who is leaving to head up the conservative Heritage Foundation, a think tank.

Joel Pollak of the conservative Breitbart.com referenced that background in a biting tweet, which he followed up with a tweet praising the senator-elect.

“Racist sexist Tea Party Republicans to welcome @RepTimScott as 1st black Senator from South since Reconstruction thanks to female Indian gov,” he wrote. Later, he clarified, “@RepTimScott a man of character & principle. Dems have diversity problem—e.g. fewer Latino elected ldrs. ‘White’ GOP is a lie.”

The conservative commentator Dana Loesch tweeted, “great news about Rep. Tim Scott.”

Colin Hanna, the president of the conservative group Let Freedom Ring, also heaped praise on Scott.

“Gov. Nikki Haley made a wise and courageous choice by nominating Rep. Tim Scott,” Hanna said in a statement. “Sen. DeMint was a voice for limited government, fiscal responsibility and the advance of liberty. We have the same hopes for Tim Scott.”
